sn31.2:1.2: Seated to one side, that mendicant said to the Buddha:
sn31.2:1.3: “Sir, what is the cause, what is the reason why someone, when their body breaks up, after death, is reborn in the company of the gods of fairykind?”
sn31.2:1.4: “Mendicant, it’s when someone does good things by way of body, speech, and mind.
sn31.2:1.6: ‘The gods of fairykind are long-lived, beautiful, and very happy.’
sn31.2:1.8: ‘If only, when my body breaks up, after death, I would be reborn in the company of the gods of fairykind!’
sn31.2:1.9: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the company of the gods of fairykind.
sn31.2:1.10: This is the cause, this is the reason why someone, when their body breaks up, after death, is reborn in the company of the gods of fairykind.”
